The said salt is in its monohydrate pseudopolymorphic form "A", which exhibits an X-ray diffraction diagram with at least two characteristic peaks around 8.5 +/- 0.5 degrees 2θ and around 15.3 +/- 0.5 degrees 2θ; or where the said salt is in its dihydrate pseudopolymorphic form "E", which has an X-ray diffraction diagram with five characteristic lines at 2θ (±0.5°) 13.65, 15.01, 15.38, 15.72, 19.42 and two characteristic lines at 15.01 and 24.57; or where the said salt is in its polymorphic form "B", which exhibits an X-ray diffraction diagram with at least two characteristic peaks around 13.0 +/- 0.5 degrees 2θ and around 16.5 +/- 0.5 degrees 2θ; or where the said salt is in its polymorphic form "D", which exhibits an X-ray diffraction diagram with five characteristic lines at 2θ (±0.1°) 16.23, 17.44, 17.75, 18.53, 22.22 and a characteristic line at 12.43. The technical result is the provision of a stable antibacterial pharmaceutical composition containing an effective amount of the sodium salt of (1R,2S,5R)-7-oxo-6-sulphoxy-1,6-diazabicyclo[3.2.1]octane-2-carboxamide of formula (I), ensuring better preservation of the active ingredient. 9 claims, 13 drawings, 12 examples.
translated_abstract.26410: The invention relates to a fluidized bed reactor for the production of para-xylene and the simultaneous production of lower olefins from methanol and/or dimethyl ether and benzene, where the lower part of the reactor with the fluidized bed serves as the reaction zone and the upper part of the reactor with the fluidized bed serves as the dilute phase zone. The reactor includes the reactor body, a distributor for the first feedstock for the reactor, and multiple distributors for the second feedstock for the reactor, with both the distributor for the first feedstock and the multiple distributors for the second feedstock arranged sequentially from bottom to top in the reaction zone. Additionally, the reactor includes a first separator for the solid and gas phases of the reactor, which is located in the dilute phase zone or outside the reactor body. This first separator for the solid and gas phases of the reactor is equipped with an opening for the input of regenerated catalyst, an opening for the unloading of catalyst from the first separator of the solid and gas phases of the reactor located in the lower part of the reaction zone, and an opening for the exit of gas from the first separator of the solid and gas phases of the reactor located in the dilute phase zone. The invention also relates to a device and a method. The proposed invention allows for an increased conversion rate of benzene, yield of para-xylene, and yield of lower olefins. 3 independent claims and 17 dependent claims, formulas, 1 illustration, 4 examples.
translated_abstract.14233: The invention relates to the field of polymer chemistry. The method of chitosan modification involves the synthesis of a copolymer containing oxirane fragments in the presence of azobisisobutyronitrile and grafting the copolymer to chitosan. The copolymer grafting is carried out by keeping chitosan in the form of chitosan films or spongy material, previously obtained in solutions of acetic acid, at 20°C for 30 minutes in a 1.5-7.5 wt.% solution of a previously obtained copolymer of glycidyl methacrylate and a selected methacrylate derivative from the series n-decyl methacrylate, lauryl methacrylate, tetradecyl methacrylate, stearyl methacrylate in methyl ethyl ketone, taken in a molar ratio of monomers equal to 9:1. Afterward, the modified chitosan is thermostatized at 140°C for 1 hour and washed from the unreacted copolymer by extraction in a Soxhlet apparatus using methyl ethyl ketone as the extracting solvent for 4 hours. The invention aims to increase the hydrophobicity of chitosan-based materials while maintaining their biodegradability and biocompatibility. 3 figures, 2 tables, 5 examples.
translated_abstract.4499: The invention relates to a device for processing a metal strip after it exits a coating application tank containing a liquid coating material, such as zinc. The device includes a blowing device (110) located above the coating application tank (300) with a slit (112) for air exit, used for blowing off excess parts of the still liquid coating material (310) from the surface of the metal strip (200) after the strip passes through the coating application tank (300). Above the blowing device (110), there is a stabilizing device (140) with individual magnets (144) to stabilize the metal strip after exiting the coating application tank (300) and the blowing device (110). At least some of the magnets (144) in the electromagnetic stabilizing device (140) are designed as cylindrical electromagnets with a cylindrical coil. This invention allows for a reduction in the vertical distance between the stabilizing device and achieves a compact form of the metal strip processing device, enhancing productivity. 11 claims, formulas, 4 drawings.
translated_abstract.22284: The invention relates to coated products that can be used for glazing. The technical result is the improvement of optical properties, specifically providing a combination of acceptable visible light transmission, desirable reflection color, low SF level, low SHGC level, and high LSG for the coated product when used in windows. The proposed coated product includes a coating applied to a glass substrate. The coating contains: a first dielectric layer comprising silicon nitride; a first infrared-reflecting layer comprising titanium nitride, on the glass substrate over at least the first dielectric layer; a second dielectric layer comprising silicon nitride, on the glass substrate over the first infrared-reflecting layer comprising titanium nitride; a second infrared-reflecting layer comprising titanium nitride, over the second dielectric layer; a third dielectric layer comprising silicon nitride, over the second infrared-reflecting layer. When measured in monolith, the coated product has: a visible light transmission rate from about 12 to 70%, a visible light reflection rate from the glass side of no more than about 16%, and a color value a* when reflecting from the glass side from -10 to +1.6. A method for manufacturing the said product is also disclosed. 5 claims and 45 dependent claims, 1 drawing, 8 tables.
translated_abstract.5811: The invention relates to devices for treating water and aqueous solutions for drinking and technological water supply and can also be used in various sectors of the national economy, particularly in facilities that do not have the capability to connect to centralized water treatment systems. The device is equipped with: a hydraulic accumulator inside which are placed a liquid pressure sensor and a shut-off valve, a liquid level sensor located in the chamber for the flow of the treated liquid, and an inlet electromagnetic valve. The inlet of the inlet electromagnetic valve is connected to the liquid source, and its outlet is connected to the inlet of the primary liquid quality control module. The inlet of the hydraulic accumulator is located at the outlet of the secondary liquid quality control module. The inlet of the outlet electromagnetic valve is connected to the first outlet of the hydraulic accumulator, and the outlet is connected to the consumer. The inlet of the electromagnetic valve of the reprocessing circuit is connected to the second outlet of the hydraulic accumulator, and the outlet is connected to the bypass input. The bypass outlet is connected to the second inlet of the chamber for the flow of the treated liquid. The control module, based on data from the primary and secondary liquid quality control modules and accordingly the liquid level sensor and liquid pressure sensor, transmits a signal to the inlet electromagnetic valve, or the outlet electromagnetic valve, or the electromagnetic valve of the reprocessing circuit depending on the data obtained, as well as to the source of high voltage electric current pulses. The invention allows for automated control of the technological processes of cleaning drinking and wastewater. 1 fig.
translated_abstract.23996: The invention relates to a compound having the structure of formula (A), or its pharmaceutically acceptable salt, which can be used for inhibiting the endosomal Toll-like receptor. In formula (A), RA represents -CH2- or -CH2CH2-; Y1 represents -CH2- or -CH2CH2-; Y2 represents -CH2- or -CH2CH2-; Y3 represents -CH2-, -XCH2-, or -CH2X-; X represents -CH2- or O; R1 represents -NHC(=O)R6, -NHC(=O)(CH2)nR6, -NH(CH2)nC(=O)R6, -NHC(=O)(CH2)mNHR5, -NHC(=O)(CH2)mN(R5)2, -NHC(=O)(CHR9)mNHR5, -NHC(=O)(CH2)mNH2, -NHC(=O)(CH2)nOR9, -NHC(=O)OR9, -NH(CH2)mC(=O)N(R5)2, -NH(CHR9)nC(=O)R6, NHC(=O)(CHR9)nR6, -NH(CHR9)mC(=O)R6, -NHR6, -NR5R6, -NH2, -N(R5)2, -NHR5, -NHR8, -NH(C(R9)2)nR10, -NR9C(=O)OR11, -NH(CH2)nR6, -NH(CHR9)nR6, -N(R6)2, -NHC(=O)(CH2)nN(CD3)2, -NH(CHR9)nCH2OR9, -NHCH2(CHR9)nOR9, -NH(CHR9)nOR9, -NR9(CH2)nOR9, -NHCH2(C(R9)2)nOR9, -OR9, -NR9C(=O)R5, -NR9C(=O)(CH2)nR5, -NR9C(=O)OR5, -NHS(=O)2R5, -NHC(=O)(CH2)nNR9C(=O)R5, -NHC(=O)(CH2)nNR9S(=O)2R5, 8-oxa-3-azabicyclo[3.2.1]octanyl or 4-6-membered heterocycloalkyl having 1-2 ring members independently chosen from N, NH, NR16, and O, which is unsubstituted or substituted with 1-2 groups R7; R2 is H, C1-C6 alkyl or C1-C6 haloalkyl; R3 is H, C1-C6 alkyl, -CD3, or benzyl substituted with 1-2 groups R10; R4 is H, NH2, C1-C6 alkyl, halogen, or phenyl substituted with 0-2 groups R18; each R5 is independently chosen from C1-C6 alkyl, -CD3, and -(CH2)nOR9; R6 is C3-C6 cycloalkyl or 4-6-membered heterocycloalkyl having 1-2 ring members independently chosen from N, NH, NR16, and O, which is unsubstituted or substituted with 1-2 groups R12; each R7 is independently chosen from C1-C6 alkyl, hydroxyl, and oxo; each R8 is independently chosen from C1-C6 haloalkyl, -(C(R9)2)nOR9, and C1-C6 alkyl substituted with 1-3 -OH; each R9 is independently chosen from H and C1-C6 alkyl; R10 is C1-C6 alkoxy or C3-C6 cycloalkyl; R11 is C3-C6 cycloalkyl, which is unsubstituted or substituted with 1-3 C1-C6 alkyl groups; each R12 is independently chosen from C1-C6 alkyl, hydroxyl, halogen, and C1-C6 alkyl substituted with 1-3 -OH; R13 is H or C1-C6 alkyl; R14 is H; each R16 is C1-C6 alkyl; each R17 is independently chosen from H and C1-C6 alkyl; each R18 is independently chosen from halogen, -CN, C1-C6 alkoxy, and C1-C6 alkyl; m equals 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6 and n equals 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. The invention also relates to a pharmaceutical composition for inhibiting the endosomal Toll-like receptor, selected from TLR7, TLR8, or TLR9 and their combinations, containing a therapeutically effective amount of the stated compound, and to a method for treating an autoimmune disease associated with the activity of the endosomal Toll-like receptor, using the compound of formula (A). 9 claims, 13 dependent claims, 7 tables, 30 examples.
translated_abstract.21164: The invention relates to the field of treating water-oil emulsions, specifically to methods that enable the separation of water-oil emulsions using the dispersion of a demulsifier under the influence of ultrasonic exposure. The invention pertains to a method of ultrasonic dispersion of a demulsifier in a water-oil emulsion, involving the introduction of the demulsifier and the treatment of the emulsion with ultrasound. A multifrequency spectrum of the acoustic wave in the water-oil emulsion after the introduction of the demulsifier is created by inducing forced vibrations of a cylindrical main pipe through which the water-oil emulsion flows. To create the forced vibrations of the pipe, the wetting perimeter by the liquid phase, the frequency spectrum of the pipe vibrations with the flowing water-oil emulsion, are determined. The resonant frequencies of the pipe and corresponding vibration modes of the pipe in the wetting perimeter zone are identified, and the locations of the antinodes on the wetting perimeter are determined. At these antinodes, sources of ultrasonic vibrations are installed, which have a working frequency equal to the resonant frequency. The length of the ultrasonically impacted pipe section is calculated using the formula: L_pipe = v × t_ultrasound, where: L_pipe - the length of the pipe section, m; v - the average actual velocity of water-oil emulsion flow at the ultrasound treatment section, m/s; t_ultrasound - empirically determined time of ultrasound exposure, defined by a specified water separation index for the specific type of emulsion and the type of demulsifier used, with a dosage rate, s. The invention also concerns an apparatus for implementing the method. Technical result - reduction of the demulsifier dosage required, diminished influence of the emulsion temperature on the oil-water separation process, and reduced phase separation time. 2 claims, 3 subclaims, 8 drawings.
translated_abstract.7335: The invention relates to the hydrometallurgy of rare metals, specifically to the technology for processing bismuth-containing materials to obtain bismuth compounds. Basic bismuth nitrate is treated with an ammonium carbonate solution at a molar ratio of ammonium carbonate to bismuth equal to 0.55-1.0, followed by the conversion of the resulting bismuth oxocarbonate into bismuth oxofumarate by treating it with a solution of fumaric acid at a molar ratio of fumaric acid to bismuth, equal to 0.6-1.0, at a process temperature of 50-80°C. The resulting bismuth oxofumarate is washed with water and dried at a temperature of 90-110°C. The technical result is a reduction in the consumption of fumaric acid and the production of a product with a nitrate ion content of less than 0.02%. 1 table, 2 examples.
translated_abstract.19504: The invention relates to the field of road construction mixtures and can be used to create modern asphalt concrete materials for road construction. The composition of the organo-mineral material includes the following components: crushed stone 20-60%, mineral powder 4-12%, basalt fiber 0.07-0.6%, organic binder 4-12%, and the remainder is sand. The basalt fiber has a density of 54-240 tex and a cutting length of 12-18 mm, while the organic binder is composed of two types of viscous road petroleum bitumens, in % of the total amount of binder in the mixture: bitumen of one of the grades: BND 90/130, BND 60/90, BND 40/60 - 85-95% combined with bitumen of one of the grades: BND 200/300, BND 130/200 - 5-15%. Technical result: obtaining a mixture for asphalt coverings with increased shear resistance, water resistance, crack resistance, and strength limit for creating a durable asphalt concrete covering. 4 tables.
translated_abstract.961: The group of inventions relates to the processing of rare earth element ore concentrates. The rare earth element ore concentrate is mixed with concentrated sulfuric acid to form a suspension mixture and the first fluorine-containing gas. The obtained suspension is mixed with a liquid initiator to initiate a reaction between the ore concentrate of rare earth elements and concentrated sulfuric acid, resulting in the formation of clinker and a second fluorine-containing gas. Subsequently, the clinker is leached with water to obtain a leached suspension. The leached suspension is separated into solid and liquid phases, resulting in the production of filtrate and leached slag. The leached slag is returned for reprocessing with the ore concentrate of rare earth elements and concentrated sulfuric acid. These inventions allow for an increased degree of exposure of the ore concentrate of rare earth elements with low energy consumption and a continuous production cycle. 2 claims, 15 subclaims, 4 examples, 6 illustrations.
translated_abstract.16253: The invention pertains to biotechnology. It describes a microorganism of a genus, possessing an enhanced ability to produce L-tryptophan compared to an unmodified microorganism, wherein the activity of a phosphatase containing the amino acid sequence SEQ ID NO: 1 is modified with inactivation to maintain the intracellular concentration of E4P (erythrose-4-phosphate). The invention also relates to a method of producing L-tryptophan using the mentioned microorganism. Furthermore, the invention relates to a method of inhibiting the degradation of intracellular E4P in a microorganism of the genus, involving the inactivation of phosphatase activity containing the amino acid sequence SEQ ID NO: 1 in the microorganism of the genus. The invention expands the arsenal of means for obtaining L-tryptophan. 3 independent claims and 1 dependent claim, 5 tables, 4 examples.
translated_abstract.20240: The group of inventions relates to medicine, specifically to devices for generating nitric oxide. The device includes a housing, an insulator, a pair of electrodes, a power source, a particle filter, an absorber, a controller, and a flow path. The housing comprises a first wall with an aperture formed therein to provide access to a recess, as well as a second wall that allows gas flow through it. The insulator is located in the recess. The electrodes are positioned inside the housing so that they contact the insulator. The power source is connected to the pair of electrodes to supply electricity to the electrodes to induce a chemical reaction inside the recess that generates nitric oxide. The filter is designed to filter particles near the second wall. The absorber is located near the particle filter to control the amount of unwanted byproducts of the chemical reaction caused by the operation of the pair of electrodes. The controller is connected to the power source and is capable of selectively supplying electricity to the pair of electrodes to achieve one or more electrical discharges between the electrodes in order to generate nitric oxide inside the housing. Along the flow path, nitric oxide is directed through the second wall of the housing into the subject's respiratory tract by means of convective transfer. This achieves the ability to reduce the need for generating nitric oxide, eliminating the need to produce a large amount of wasted gaseous nitric oxide. 4 claims and 53 dependent claims, 23 drawings.
translated_abstract.16771: The invention relates to the field of biotechnology. It represents a set of oligonucleotides for analyzing the bovine leukemia virus provirus using real-time polymerase chain reaction. It includes three forward primers: env_5400_F ttc-cct-ctg-tca-gat-cat-gg; env_5442_F cac-ggg-cct-tcc-cag-a; env F aag-ggc-ggc-gcc-ggt-tt, one reverse primer env_5620_R gga-agg-gtg-gtg-cca-tc, and two fluorescently quenched TagMan probes: env_5441 (ROX) ct-acg-ggc-ctt-ccc-ag (RTQ2); env_5549 (FAM) ct-ccc-gga-cgc-cca-aa (RTQ1), allowing for the quantitative determination of the BLV provirus with increased sensitivity and high specificity. The proposed set of oligonucleotides enhances sensitivity, specificity, and accuracy of the quantitative determination of the BLV provirus using real-time PCR. 3 figs., 3 tables.
translated_abstract.10151: The invention relates to substituted spiroandrostene-17,6'[1,3,4]thiadiazines of general formula (1), where R=H or F. Technical result: new compounds of formula (1) have been obtained, possessing antiviral activity against herpes viruses, with low cellular toxicity. 1 claim, 2 tables, 5 examples.
translated_abstract.24955: The invention relates to multi-stage water treatment systems and can be used to control water purification systems for domestic, drinking, and industrial purposes [C02F 1/00, C02F 9/00]. The claimed system controls the nodes of a universal modular automatic water purification installation, in which the input mechanical filter functions as an auto-backwash filter and has a unit for automatic switching to backwash mode. The output of the input filter is connected to an automatic feed pump, whose output is connected to a flocculator-ejector; the flocculator-ejector has three inputs: the main one - filtered water from the outlet of the feed pump and two additional ones, one of which is connected to an automatic dosing pump, the other to an oxygen or ozone oxygenator, with the automatic doser having a second input coming from the signal output of the water meter, and the output of the flocculator is connected to the input of the reactor tank, the output of which is connected to the input of the process pump, the output of which is sequentially connected to the pressure filter for iron removal, a pressure adsorbing filter, and a membrane fine cleaning filter, the output stream from which is led to the input of a storage tank, having drain ports and an outlet channel connected to the input of the distribution pump, whose output is connected to the input of the UFO module, and the UFO module is connected to a monitoring controller, which is capable of controlling all the pumps of the system through local controllers, which are installed at each system node along with water condition sensors at each node, and each of these control sensors for a specific system node is connected to the local controller of that node. The technical result of the invention is the improvement and simplification of the installation design facilitated by the use of distributed control of water purification plant nodes, which results in higher quality of purified water, reduced installation costs, and increased system reliability. 2 claims, 5 dependent claims, 1 drawing.
translated_abstract.14992:
The present invention relates to a vulcanization activator and methods for producing a vulcanization activator. The vulcanization activator comprises: zinc oxide in an amount of 10-90 wt.%, a fatty acid with the general formula CH(CH)COOH, where n=10-20, or CH(CH)CH=CH(CH)COOH, where n=5-10, in an amount of 0.5-3 wt.%, and a solid carrier – the remainder. The method for producing the vulcanization activator includes grinding a mixture of solid carrier, zinc oxide, and fatty acid with the general formula CH(CH)COOH, where n=10-20, or CH(CH)CH=CH(CH)COOH, where n=5-10, in the working chamber of a rotary-inertial mill with a shear force of 10-50 N at a shear rate of 20-100 m/s, followed by mixing in a centrifugal-elliptical mill with an acceleration of 10-50g. Another method for producing the vulcanization activator includes grinding the solid carrier in a vertical mill, then mixing with zinc oxide and fatty acid of the type with the general formula CH (CH) COOH, where n=10-20, or CH (CH) CH=CH (CH) COOH, where n=5-10, treating the mixture under the impact forces in a rod mill with a collision speed of 50-230 m/s.

Technical result – simplification of the process due to the elimination of the need to extract the activator from an aqueous solution of polymer surfactant and the recovery of the latter. Also, improving the characteristics of vulcanized rubbers. 3 claims, 12 dependent claims, 1 table, 7 examples.
translated_abstract.15063: The present invention relates to the brewing industry. Three methods for producing malt from cereal grain are proposed. In one method, the process includes conditioning cereal grains to a moisture content in the grain in the range of 20 to 30% by soaking the said cereal grains in an aqueous solution for a period of 5 to 20 hours, given that the initial moisture content of these cereal grains is <18%. Then, the cereal grains are contacted with an aqueous solution of one or more enzymes with hydrolase activity. The grains are held until they germinate and are then dried to a moisture content of 6 to 12%. In another method, it involves conditioning the grain to a moisture content in the grain in the range of 15-80%, and within a time period of not more than one day to maintain moisture within the specified range, followed by sprinkling and/or soaking the conditioned grain in an aqueous solution of a food enzyme with hydrolase activity. Afterward, the grains are held until germination with mass transfer of the enzyme from the aqueous phase into the volume of the grain, and the grains are dried to a moisture content of 6-12%. Furthermore, conditioning and/or holding is carried out until achieving a geometric ratio of the size of the channels between the starch granules in the grain to the hydraulic diameter of the enzyme molecule, which ranges from 0.8 to 0.95. This geometric ratio is obtained by dividing the hydraulic diameter of the enzyme molecule by the size of the channel. Also proposed are the malt produced by these methods, a malt-based product, and a method for producing a beverage based on this malt. The invention aims to improve the quality of malt. 6 claims, 39 dependent claims, 1 figure, 2 tables, 4 examples.
translated_abstract.1985: The invention pertains to silicone hydrogels produced from reactive mixtures containing a triblock forpolymer, and to ophthalmological devices manufactured therefrom. A proposed triblock forpolymer features a chemical structure of [A]-[B]-[C], containing at least one univalent reactive group, where segments [A] and [C] independently contain polymeric segments formed from a hydrophilic monomer selected from hydroxy-substituted (meth)acrylates and acrylamides, and [B] is a segment of the polymer chain formed from polydimethylsiloxane with terminal mono-n-butyl and monomethacryloxypropyl groups. This triblock forpolymer contains at least one terminal univalent reactive group, and is formed using a tellurium-organic mediator of living radical polymerization (TERP). These forpolymers can be used alone or in combination with other components in reactive monomeric mixtures to manufacture silicone hydrogels and from them ophthalmological devices, including contact lenses. The technical result is that contact lenses made using the proposed triblock forpolymer demonstrate an excellent combination of physical, mechanical, and biological properties, including increased permeability of tear film components. 5 claims and 38 dependent claims, 1 drawing, 13 tables, 51 examples.
translated_abstract.15201: The present invention relates to a microorganism producing L-lysine and a method for producing L-lysine using this microorganism. The invention allows for the production of L-lysine with a high degree of efficiency. 2 claims, 2 dependent claims, 6 tables, 9 examples.
translated_abstract.19004: The invention relates to the field of electrochemical production of materials suitable for operation under high-temperature fuel cell conditions. The method of applying heat-resistant coating, mimicking Co-Cr-W based stellite, on the surface of stainless steel includes electrochemical coating application and dehydrogenation treatment. In this method, the electrochemical coating application is conducted from an aqueous dimethylformamide solution (1:1) containing CrCl3 at a concentration of 1.2-1.7 mol/L, cobalt chloride at a concentration of 0.005-0.01 mol/L, and sodium tungstate at a concentration of 0.01-0.05 mol/L at pH 1.2–2.0 and a current density of 20-50 A/dm2. The dehydrogenation treatment is carried out in a gradient mode from an initial temperature of 120±10°C to a final temperature of 220±10°C over 3 hours, using protective screens made of polypropylene to ensure even current distribution. Technical result: Obtaining a heat-resistant coating mimicking Co-Cr-W based stellite on the surface of stainless steel, uniform in thickness and chemical composition, extends the operational life of the fuel cell while simplifying the application of the heat-resistant coating. 4 illustrations, 2 tables, 5 examples.
translated_abstract.9356: The invention relates to a method for obtaining a concentrate of aqueous colloidal gold-quartz solution and to the concentrate of aqueous colloidal gold-quartz solution itself, which exhibits antimicrobial and antitoxic properties. It can be used in the perfume industry, food industry, medicine, agriculture, veterinary science, biology, and other fields. To obtain the concentrate, 50 grams of washed river quartz sand are added to 1 liter of structured water. The mixture is then placed in an ultrasonic bath with a power of 35 Watts and subjected to ultrasonic treatment for at least 20 minutes. The resultant colloidal aqueous quartz solution is separated from the residual quartz sand crystals, and 0.3 grams of edible gold leaf is added to it. This mixture is placed back into the ultrasonic bath and exposed to shock ultrasonic waves ranging from 18 to 44 kHz while being simultaneously heated up to 40°C, for at least 30 minutes until a golden-colored concentrate of aqueous colloidal gold-quartz solution is obtained. The concentrate of aqueous colloidal gold-quartz solution contains, in mg/L: Silicon 20-40, Gold 0.05, structured water remaining. The process ensures an increase in the concentration of colloidal gold particles in water when obtaining the colloidal system. 2 independent claims, formulas.
translated_abstract.11104: The invention relates to a method for obtaining pure 1,3-butadiene from an unprocessed C4 fraction as a result of extractive distillation with a selective solvent, in which a) a liquid unprocessed C4 fraction is fed into the feed zone of a pre-distillation column, which is divided in the middle section by a partition, oriented primarily in the longitudinal direction of the pre-distillation column, into the feed zone and the side output zone. A first low-boiling fraction containing C3 hydrocarbons is taken off as a top stream, a gaseous C4 fraction as a side stream from the side output zone, and a first high-boiling fraction as a bottom stream; b) in at least one extraction column, the gaseous C4 fraction is contacted with a selective solvent, resulting in a top fraction containing butanes and butenes, and a bottom fraction containing 1,3-butadiene and selective solvent; c) in at least one degassing column, unpurified 1,3-butadiene is desorbed from the bottom fraction, yielding a degassed selective solvent, and the degassed selective solvent is sent back to the extraction column; and d) at least part of the unpurified 1,3-butadiene is fed into a fine distillation column, a second high-boiling fraction is separated, a gaseous exhaust stream is withdrawn, and the second high-boiling fraction is sent back to the lower section of the pre-distillation column. The proposed method allows for maintaining the production regime over a long period while achieving high output of pure 1,3-butadiene. 10 claims, 1 drawing, 3 tables, 3 examples.
translated_abstract.22204: The invention pertains to simulators of poisonous substances and can be used for simulating indication objects during the training of specialists in radiation, chemical, and biological protection forces in order to grant them practical skills in using chemical reconnaissance equipment designed for detecting chemical contamination incidents. The simulation recipe for training specialists in radiation, chemical, and biological protection includes an active component that produces an indication effect, and an organic filler. Diazinon is used as the active component, and diesel fuel is the organic filler. The composition also includes an organic co-solvent - solvent R-4, and a surfactant - didecyl ether of phosphoric acid, with the following ratio of components, in mass %: diazinon 24, diesel fuel 54, solvent R-4 20, didecyl ether of phosphoric acid 2. This ensures the activation of chemical reconnaissance equipment both remotely and through local action principles. 1 table.
translated_abstract.13480: The invention relates to the field of building materials, specifically to spatially reinforcing additives, and can be used for preparing polystyrene concrete. Polystyrene concrete for construction with PET fiber is obtained from a mix containing cement, sand, granulated polystyrene, and fiber. The mixture contains (per 1 m³): 300 kg of 500-grade cement; 800 kg of 0.5 fraction sand; 1.1 m³ of granulated polystyrene; 200 liters of water; from 10 to 20 kg of rectangular cross-section fiber 2 to 3 mm wide and 18 to 30 mm long. The fiber is made from cylindrical PET containers, such as bottles, set at a 15° angle to the horizontal blade when being spirally cut. The spatial reinforcement of the polystyrene concrete with spirally shaped polyethylene terephthalate fiber increases the concrete's resistance to cracking, bending, and tensile loads, allowing it to maintain the necessary strength and preserve the shape of the polystyrene concrete even during significant deformations, enabling the concrete to function "elastically." 1 illustration, 1 table.
translated_abstract.1624: The invention relates to methods for obtaining silicon-containing compounds, specifically to a method for obtaining aminosilanes. A method for obtaining aminosilanes of general formula (I), where n=1, 2, or 3, is proposed, comprising the interaction of 3-aminopropyltriethoxysilane with 2-alkylaminoethanol, characterized in that monoethanolamine is used as the 2-alkylaminoethanol in the presence of a binary antioxidant and an alkali metal alkoxide under vacuum and gradual heating up to 100°C. The technical result is the production of the target product with high yield and high conversion of raw materials, simplification of the process and minimization of its duration, and reduction of energy consumption during production. 1 table, 3 examples.
translated_abstract.21897: The invention relates to methods of biochemical treatment of wastewater from slaughterhouses, oil and fat industry enterprises, and food processing plants. Cultures of the microscopic fungus Hypomyces odoratus 94/77 VKPM F-242 are introduced into the wastewater. Its cultivation is conducted within a pH range of the medium (4.0-6.0) and at a wastewater temperature of 24-26°C. The water treatment is carried out over 16-24 hours. Technical result: improved degree of wastewater purification and fat extraction, increased yield of protein biomass, cost reduction of the purification process through shorter cultivation periods of the fungus, use of the most optimal temperature for treatment facilities, and a wider range of medium acidity. 3 tables, 3 examples.
translated_abstract.18649: The invention can be used for coating metal surfaces of gangways, staircases, bridges, pedestrian pathways, car ramps, helicopter pads, and ship decks. The method for obtaining a non-slip coating includes surface preparation and polymer coating application. The surface preparation is conducted through abrasive blast cleaning. Subsequently, a metallic sublayer made of an aluminum-magnesium alloy with a thickness of 100-1000 microns is applied by arc spray metallization, followed by a layer of polymer-abrasive composition with a thickness of 300-1000 microns, which is injected onto the metallic sublayer preheated by a gas flame to a temperature of 150-200°C, with accompanying heating of the forming coating by a gas flame. Thermoplastic powder material is used as the polymer material. The abrasive material used has a grain size of 0.1-3 mm. After the injection of the polymer-abrasive composition is stopped, the coating is heat treated with a gas flame until the melting temperature of the polymer component is reached. The resulting coatings are distinguished by enhanced operational characteristics such as mechanical resistance to abrasion and high static friction force. Example 1.
translated_abstract.15715: The group of inventions relates to a new extractant for extracting rare earth metals from an aqueous solution of phosphoric acid present in this solution, as well as to the application of this extractant for treating aqueous solutions obtained from the leaching of natural phosphates with sulfuric acid, and aqueous solutions obtained from the leaching of household waste with phosphoric acid. The extractant contains a compound having a formula where R1 and R2, being identical or different, represent a saturated or unsaturated, linear or branched hydrocarbon group containing 6-12 carbon atoms; R3 represents a saturated or unsaturated, linear or branched hydrocarbon group containing 1 to 6 carbon atoms and optionally one or more heteroatoms, or a saturated or unsaturated, monocyclic hydrocarbon group containing 3 to 8 carbon atoms and optionally one or more heteroatoms; R4 and R5 being identical or different, represent a hydrogen atom or a saturated or unsaturated, linear or branched hydrocarbon group containing 2-8 carbon atoms, and a surfactant. The inventions allow the extraction of rare earth metals with high selectivity relative to metallic impurities contained in the aqueous solution across a maximally wide range of phosphoric acid concentrations. 4 claims, 20 patent items, 5 figures, 4 tables, 6 examples.
translated_abstract.3295: The invention relates to the use of the sodium salt of diethyl ether of 4-oxo-1,4-dihydropyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazine-3,8-dicarboxylic acid, monohydrate of formula I, as a means for the treatment and prevention of long-term consequences of diabetes. The sodium salt of diethyl ether of 4-oxo-1,4-dihydropyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazine-3,8-dicarboxylic acid, monohydrate, is an effective means for the treatment and prevention of the formation of diabetic complications such as nephropathy, cardiomyopathy, neuropathy, encephalopathy, endothelial dysfunction, and hemorheological disorders, and may find wide application in medicine for therapy of late complications of diabetes. 13 illustrations.
translated_abstract.14835: The invention relates to variants of a method for extracting natural gas from hydrocarbon reservoirs for oil and gas in an underground environment. One variant of the method includes: (a) if necessary, drilling a well on the ocean floor to extract hydrocarbons in the form of natural gas or a mix of oil and natural gas; (b) extracting hydrocarbons in the form of natural gas or a mixture of oil and natural gas; (c) separating oil from natural gas in a separator; (d) if necessary, transporting, pumping, or delivering oil via a pipeline to the ocean surface; (e) cleaning natural gas from debris material; (f) transporting, pumping, or delivering natural gas via a pipeline to an underwater facility for converting the gas into clathrate hydrate; (g) converting natural gas to obtain solid hydrates; (h) collecting solid hydrates in a transport container suitable for transporting solid hydrates to the ocean surface. The method allows for efficient, environmentally friendly, and safe extraction and transportation of natural gas from underwater environments for consumption. 3 claims and 7 subclaims, formulas, 6 illustrations.
translated_abstract.10462: The invention relates to a building material, such as a facing panel. The method for producing building material includes a first stage, where a first UV-curable paint is applied to an inorganic material containing wooden reinforcement, and this paint is not fully cured. At the second stage, a second UV-curable paint is applied and fully cured. At the third stage, the fully cured second UV-curable paint is polished to smooth its surface. At the fourth stage, enamel paint is applied and cured. At the second stage, the second UV-curable paint applied consists of a paint containing a filler in an amount of 40 to 70% by mass relative to the solid content, while the first UV-curable paint is not fully cured. The invention allows for an improved surface with a mirror finish coating of the inorganic material containing wooden reinforcement. 5 claims, 3 drawings, 2 tables.
translated_abstract.26234: The invention relates to the field of biochemistry, specifically to an antibody that specifically binds to PD-1. Also disclosed are a composition containing said antibody, a nucleic acid encoding said antibody, a vector, and a host cell containing said nucleic acid. Disclosed are methods for treating cancer and infectious disease, diagnostics, selection, detection, enhancement using said antibody, methods for producing said antibody, methods for propagating a population of T-cells, and use of said antibody for preparing a medicament for detecting PD-1. The invention allows for the effective treatment of diseases associated with PD-1. 18 claims, 3 dependent claims, 24 figures, 1 example, 1 table.
translated_abstract.7562: The invention relates to a compound of formula I or its pharmaceutically acceptable salt, where Z represents a halogen-substituted phenoxy methyl carbonyl; A represents -CH-; B and D represent hydrogen; R represents hydrogen; R represents hydrogen and R is selected from the group consisting of cyclohexyl, cyclopentyl, morpholino, phenyl, piperidinyl, pyridinyl, tetrahydrofuran, tetrahydropyran, 1,2,3,4-tetrahydronaphthyl, and thiazolyl, each of which is independently unsubstituted or independently substituted with 1-3 members selected from methyl, methoxy, trifluoromethyl, acetyl, and -N; and R represents hydrogen. The compounds of formula I are intended for the inhibition of lysine-specific gingipain. 2 claims and 6 subclaims, formulas, 10 drawings, 2 tables, 37 examples.
translated_abstract.21614: This group of inventions relates to the field of veterinary medicine, specifically to pharmaceuticals, and can be used to treat infections of bacterial etiology. The method for obtaining antimicrobial peptides from Musca domestica larvae includes grinding a sample of larvae in a mortar with sand to a homogeneous mass with the addition of a solution consisting of 0.25% sodium azide and phosphate buffer, mixing for 4 hours, centrifuging, and collecting the aqueous layer containing antimicrobial peptides. Then, salting out is carried out by adding (NH₄)₂SO₄ to the obtained solution, placing the solution in a freezer at t=5-10°C for 24 hours, centrifuging for 40 minutes at t=5°C at a speed of 4200 rpm, and chromatographic separation of peptides with the extraction of a fraction of peptide mixture weighing 3.4-6 kDa. The obtained mixture is subjected to dialysis for 24 hours against a 0.9% sodium chloride solution, filtered, and packaged. This group of inventions also relates to a composition of antimicrobial peptides containing a mixture of antimicrobial peptides from Musca domestica larvae, obtained by the said method. This group of inventions provides the extraction of peptides from Musca domestica larvae that possess antibacterial activity. Includes 2 claims, 1 drawing, 2 tables.
translated_abstract.7607: The invention relates to the field of biotechnology. A method for sequencing nucleic acids is described, which includes the stage of detecting the incorporation of a labeled nucleotide into a growing polynucleotide chain complementary to the strand of the template polynucleotide, via polymerase linked to the conducting channel of a solid substrate through a linker. The invention expands the toolkit for sequencing nucleic acids. 14 claims, 28 drawings, 2 tables.
translated_abstract.11142: The invention relates to oil refining, specifically to the composition of automotive gasoline intended for use as fuel for the first refueling of vehicles. A gasoline for the first refueling of vehicles is proposed, characterized by the compounding of the following components: alkylate from acid alkylation gasoline production units; isomerate from isomerization units of light gasoline fractions with pre-hydrofining blocks; butane-butylene fraction from catalytic cracking units, methyl tert-butyl ether, and the multifunctional additive HITEC 6437 ECTO, in the following ratio, wt%: alkylate 51-75, isomerate 15-35, butane-butylene fraction ≤4, methyl tert-butyl ether ≤15, multifunctional additive HITEC 6437 ECTO ≤0.1. The technical result is the production of gasoline with high octane characteristics, both by the research and motor methods, low content of harmful emissions released during combustion, absence of carbon formation and corrosive properties. 2 tables.
translated_abstract.15885: The invention relates to the wine-making industry for determining the sparkling properties in beverages saturated with CO2. The method for determining the sparkling properties of CO2-saturated beverages includes preliminary sample collection; cleaning the bottle from labels; thermostatting for 1 hour at 20°C; weighing the bottle with the sparkling beverage, an afronmeter with a tap, a foam catcher with a gas vent pipe, a gasket, and a universal clamp; measuring the excess CO2 pressure in the bottle; characterized in that after the excess CO2 pressure is reduced to atmospheric by gradually opening the afronmeter tap (preventing foam ejection), with the tap fully open under thermostatic conditions, the weight of the bottle with the beverage is determined at equal time intervals with an interval of 1 min for one hour on precision scales of high accuracy (class II) and constructing a CO2 desorption curve, where time in minutes is plotted on the x-axis, and the mass of released carbon dioxide (g) on the y-axis, allows to address the aforementioned problem. During the measurements, as an indicator characterizing the sparkling properties of the beverage, a sparkling property coefficient (K) is used, calculated by the formula: K=C:V, where C is the total content of carbon dioxide in the beverage sample (g), V is the rate of desorption of carbon dioxide over the selected time interval (g/min). The invention allows for more accurate measurements using standard laboratory equipment. 6 illustrations, 4 examples.
translated_abstract.23028: Broadband electromagnetic absorbing coating is designed for absorbing electromagnetic radiation in terrestrial, aviation, space, and marine equipment technologies with the aim of reducing their radar visibility, as well as for absorbing electromagnetic radiation in shielding devices, absorbing linings and enclosures, anechoic measurement chambers, and in means of protecting the population from non-ionizing radiations. The broadband electromagnetic absorbing coating, comprising a base of at least one layer of radio-transparent fabric with an absorbing film applied to one or both sides, made of a radio-transparent material containing copper-nickel alloy nanoparticles, is characterized in that the nanoparticles consist of 25-50 mass % Cu, the rest being Ni, and their size does not exceed the skin layer thickness in this alloy at the maximum frequency of the coating absorption range. The use of the proposed broadband electromagnetic absorbing coating will provide effective absorption of electromagnetic radiation across a wide frequency range (10 MHz - 700 GHz). 1 table, 3 figs.
translated_abstract.25476: The invention pertains to the wine-making industry. The adsorbent includes vegetable protein, obtained from preliminarily degreased and ground vegetable raw materials, not brought to a dry state, and additionally the following ingredients, in mass%: ethyl alcohol – 3.0-8.0, citric or tartaric acid, or a mixture thereof - 0.5-3.0, sulfur dioxide - 0.5-1.5, and water – 67.5-86. The invention allows for the improvement of the adsorbent quality for clarifying must, stabilizing wine materials, juices, beer, and non-alcoholic beverages against colloidal turbidity through the more complete removal of undesirable components. 1 table, 3 examples.
translated_abstract.11563: The invention relates to a building material and to a method for producing a building material. The method for producing the building material includes a first stage of curing the material of the inner layer, containing a hydraulic material, silica-containing material, and aluminum powder, resulting in a foamed inner layer, where the aluminum powder reacts to form bubbles, and the hydraulic material and silica-containing material do not fully harden; a second stage of distributing the material of the surface layer, containing a hydraulic material and silica-containing material, to obtain a non-foamed surface layer; a third stage of laying the foamed inner layer on the non-foamed surface layer to form a stack containing the non-foamed surface layer and the foamed inner layer; and a fourth stage of pressing and curing the mentioned stack, to produce a building material having a ratio of the mass of the non-foamed surface layer to the mass of the foamed inner layer of 10-45:55-90. Variants of the building material are also described. 3 claims, 14 dependent claims, 2 drawings, 1 table.
translated_abstract.25234: The invention relates to the field of biotechnology, specifically to immunostimulatory protein constructs based on CD154, and can be used in medicine for the treatment of diseases associated with immunity, autoimmune diseases, allergies, lymphoproliferative disorders, cancer, infectious and inflammatory diseases. A nucleic acid (NA) is proposed, encoding a transmembrane protein based on CD154, wherein the NA does not contain a sequence capable of encoding either the intracellular portion of CD154 or the intracellular portion of CD40. Also proposed are a plasmid or viral genetic carrier containing the said NA, for the expression of the immunostimulatory CD40-binding protein, and the protein itself for use in therapy. The invention allows for the production of a therapeutically active protein that trimerizes, is retained in the plasma membrane, and retains the immunostimulatory ability of CD154. 4 claims, 16 subclaims, formulas, 23 figures, 2 tables, 16 examples.
translated_abstract.9442: The invention relates to the field of biotechnology. It proposes a method for determining the coordinates of cellular structure changes using phase images during the modulation of the wavefront phase. This method includes dividing the radiation passing through the cell into several beams, selecting a point with coordinates (x1, y1) on the cell surface in the phase image obtained at an angle coinciding with the optical axis at the first moment in time, where the change in the cell structure is determined, selecting phase values at other angles in the phase images with coordinates (x1sinϕ+zcosϕ, y1), summing them to obtain a function dependent on the z-coordinate along the optical axis, calculating the sum of phases with the same coordinates at another moment in time, obtaining the same function, determining the z-coordinate at which a global extremum of the difference between these two functions is reached, and determining the coordinate z1 inside the cell where the structure change occurs, taking (x1, y1, z1) as the coordinates of the cell structure change. The invention enables the determination of changes in the position of the membrane and internal structure within the cell. It includes 3 figures, 1 table.
translated_abstract.16456:
The invention relates to a catalyst composition, a method for its preparation, and a process for processing heavy hydrocarbon feedstock in its presence in order to obtain high-value-added petroleum products. Described is a catalyst for processing heavy hydrocarbon feedstock, obtained by sulfidizing a composition containing an active component and a support. This is characterized by the active component consisting of a heteropoly compound containing at least one of the following compounds in the series [CoMoOH], Co[PMoO], Ni[PMoO], [Co(OH)MoO], [Ni(OH)MoO], [NiMoOH], [Co(OH)WO], [PMoWO] (where n = 1-11), [PVMoO] (where n = 1-4), MoO(OH)H[Co(HO)] or their mixture and an organic additive such as citric acid, glycol, or EDTA. The support consists of aluminum oxide, silicon oxide, magnesium oxide, zeolite, aluminosilicate, porous alumophosphate, porous silicoalumophosphate, or their combination, having a regular spatial structure of macropores, where the portion of macropores ranging in size from 50 nm to 15 μm constitutes no less than 30% of the total specific pore volume, with a specific surface area not less than 40 m/g, an external surface portion not less than 50%, and a specific pore volume not less than 0.1 cm/g. The content in the calcined catalyst (at 550°C) of cobalt is no more than 20 weight%, nickel no more than 20 weight%, molybdenum no more than 20 weight%, and tungsten no more than 20 weight%, the content of the organic additive constitutes 5-15 weight% of the catalyst weight.

The method for processing heavy hydrocarbon feedstock using the described catalyst involves passing the raw material through a fixed layer of the catalyst at a temperature of 300-550°C, with a raw material supply rate through the catalyst of 0.1-2 g-raw material/g-catalyst/h, in the presence of hydrogen, supplied under a pressure of 7-15 MPa. The technical result is achieving high activity (large conversions in reactions of sulfur removal, metals, asphaltenes, heavy hydrocarbons, reducing density and viscosity, etc.) and stability (extended service life) of the catalyst under harsh conditions for processing heavy hydrocarbons. 3 claims, 3 dependent claims, formulae, 11 examples, 1 table.
translated_abstract.20939: The invention relates to immunology. A proposed isolated antibody specifically binds to the O25b antigen of E.coli strains. The application of such an antibody for treating a patient at risk of or suffering from an infection caused by O25b-positive E.coli strains, a pharmaceutical preparation, a kit, and a method for diagnosing the infection are considered. In addition, a nucleic acid encoding the antibody, expression cassettes, plasmids, host cell, and a method for producing the antibody are presented. This invention may find further applications in the diagnostics and therapy of O25b-positive E.coli strains. 16 claims, 3 subclaims, formulas, 10 illustrations, 4 examples.
translated_abstract.2019: The invention relates to the field of biotechnology, specifically to the production of highly glycosylated fused proteins based on human Factor VIII (FVIII), and can be used in medicine to prevent or treat hemorrhagic diseases in patients with FVIII deficiency. The proposed homodimeric fused protein consists of, sequentially from N- to C-terminus, human blood coagulation factor VIII, a flexible peptide linker, at least one rigid carboxy-terminal peptide segment of the beta subunit of human chorionic gonadotropin, and the Fc fragment of human immunoglobulin. The invention allows for the production of a protein with a level of biological activity similar to that of recombinant FVIII and an extended half-life in vivo, i.e., a medicinal product based on FVIII with improved pharmacokinetics and efficacy. 7 claims and 4 dependent claims are included, with 5 illustrations and 3 tables.
translated_abstract.7622: The present invention relates to a method for processing by-products of the synthesis of 4,4-dimethyl-1,3-dioxane, which are formed from isobutylene and formaldehyde and/or substances that are their sources, decomposing on an aluminosilicate-containing catalyst in the presence of steam at a temperature of 400-480°C. The method is characterized in that before decomposition, the by-products from the synthesis stage of 4,4-dimethyl-1,3-dioxane are mixed with demineralized water and the aqueous layer of the condensate of the reaction mass from the liquid-phase synthesis of isoprene in a ratio of BPP: demineralized water : aqueous layer of the condensate of the reaction mass from the liquid-phase synthesis of isoprene, equal to 1:(0.1-0.28):(0.01-0.06) respectively. The resulting mixture is subjected to hydrolysis at a temperature of 100-155°C and a pressure from atmospheric to 1.0 MPa, followed by evaporation of the obtained hydrolyzate in a stream of steam at a temperature of 190-250°C and a pressure of 0.2-1.0 MPa, and the formed gas is fed for catalytic decomposition. Technical result: increase in the total yield of useful products, reduction of coke deposition, increase in the conversion of the heavy residue. 2 examples.
translated_abstract.23956: The invention relates to water treatment, specifically to a method for purifying water from radon and radon decay products. The method includes filtering the water through a sorbent material and rinsing the sorbent material with water heated to a temperature not exceeding 90°C, collecting and holding the rinse water in a collection tank until the radon and short-lived radon decay products decay. After holding in the collection tank, the rinse water is purified from long-lived radon decay products by filtering through an additional filter containing an inorganic sorbent material in the form of hydrated oxides of zirconium or manganese. The proposed method allows for the deactivation of rinse waters formed during the purification of water from radon and radon decay products. 1 ill., 2 ex.
translated_abstract.26421: The invention pertains to biotechnology, specifically to the universal recombinant vector pBuc and the plasmid genetic construct pBuc-7B4, which facilitates the synthesis and secretion of full-sized recombinant monoclonal antibody proteins, particularly the 7B4 antibody against the West Nile virus, in Chinese hamster ovary (CHO) cells, obtained using the mentioned vector pBuc. This can be utilized in medicine and biotechnology. These proteins will possess therapeutic potential. They can also be used for scientific research purposes. The invention allows for the creation of the universal integration vector pBuc and the plasmid genetic construct pBuc-7B4, facilitating the synthesis and secretion of the 7B4 antibody against the West Nile virus in animal cells, obtained with the use of the indicated vector pBuc. 2 patent claims, 3 drawings, 2 tables, 4 examples.
translated_abstract.5012: The invention relates to biodegradable films that can be used in medicine, pharmaceuticals, food, and cosmetics industries, as well as for producing packaging materials. The method for producing a biodegradable film from a mixture of components based on potato starch according to the first variant includes thorough mixing of the mixture components, ultrasonic treatment, heating in a water bath, cooling, forming the film on a glass surface, and drying it. This method uses the following component ratio by weight percentage: potato starch 4.2-5.0, sodium alginate 0.1-0.8, glycerin 5.0-20.0, distilled water - the remainder. Potato starch with added sodium alginate is dissolved in distilled water and mixed using a mechanical stirrer at a speed of 120 rpm for 5 minutes. After mixing, glycerin is added, and the resulting suspension is treated with ultrasonic waves at a frequency of 22±1.65 kHz and power of 630 W for 5 minutes at a temperature of 28±4°C. The solution is then heated for no more than 5 minutes in a water bath while stirring at a temperature of 80-90°C, cooled to 50°C, the films are formed by pouring onto a glass surface with subsequent distribution of the solution across the surface, and dried at a temperature of 20-25°C. The method of obtaining biodegradable film according to the second variant from a mixture of components based on potato starch includes thorough mixing of the mixture components, ultrasonic treatment, heating in a water bath, cooling, forming the film on a glass surface and drying it, using the following ratio of components, mass%: potato starch 1.2-2.2; sodium alginate 2.8-3.2; glycerin 1.9-2.1; decinormal hydrochloric acid solution 2.8-3.2; decinormal sodium hydroxide solution until pH=7; distilled water - the remainder. Potato starch with added sodium alginate is dissolved in distilled water, mixed with a mechanical stirrer at a speed of 120 rpm for 5 minutes, and after mixing, glycerin and decinormal hydrochloric acid solution are added. The pH is adjusted to 7 with a decinormal solution of sodium hydroxide, the obtained suspension is treated with ultrasonic waves with a frequency of 22±1.65 kHz and power of 630 W for 3-5 minutes, then the solution is heated for no more than 5 minutes in a water bath with constant stirring at a temperature of 80-90°C, cooled to 50°C, the films are formed by pouring onto a glass surface with subsequent distribution of the solution across the surface and dried at a temperature of 20-25°C. The technical result of the invention is the development of a biodegradable composite material based on plant biopolymers, which possesses sufficient elasticity and strength. 2 patent claims, 2 drawings, 2 tables.
translated_abstract.20804: The group of inventions relates to a photo-curable composition suitable for use in dentistry, a dental filling material based on it, and its application. The proposed composition contains a polymerizable monomer (A), a spherical filler (B) with an average particle size in the range of 230-350 nm, a complex filler consisting of an organic polymer matrix and spherical filler (B), and a polymerization initiator (C). The composition is such that: monomer (A) contains multiple (meth)acrylic compounds and its refractive index at 25°C is in the range of 1.38-1.55; 90% or more of individual particles making up filler (B) are within ±5% of the average particle size; the refractive index nP (25°C) of the polymer obtained by polymerizing monomer (A) is less than the refractive index nF (25°C) of filler (B); the refractive index nD (25°C) of the organic polymer matrix is less than nF (25°C) of filler (B); the difference between nF and nP and the difference between nF and nD ranges from 0.002 to 0.05; the organic polymer matrix is a homopolymer or copolymer of a (meth)acrylic compound and its refractive index at 25°C is in the range of 1.40-1.57; filler (B) consists of spherical particles of complex oxides based on silica and titanium group oxides, and its refractive index at 25°C is in the range of 1.45-1.58; initiator (C) contains a photosensitizer compound (C1), a tertiary amine compound (C2), and a photoacid precursor (C3) where (C3) is an aryl iodinium salt capable of generating, through a cleavage reaction, an acid with an acid dissociation constant in water at 25°C of -3.0 or higher. The dental filling material, consisting of the described composition, is suitable for use in filling a cavity, including when the dentin has a brownish-reddish color shade. The composition ensures the formation of a cured product whose appearance matches that of natural teeth and maintains this correspondence over an extended period of time. The composition is characterized by high resistance to weak light (such as ambient lighting), and polymerization is completed in a very short time when irradiated with active light using a light emitter commonly used for polymerization and curing. 3 claims, 2 dependent claims, 7 tables, 12 examples.
